source.821d087e: The purpose of this notebook is to provide a visual overview (interactive map) of the average prices throughout the areas (neighborhoods) of Iowa.
source.ab8086b0: Every marker on the map represents a neighborhood of our dataset. Clicking on a marker displays the name of the neighborhood and the average price of houses in that neighborhood. The color represents whether the average price is low, medium or high.
source.0d0fcab5: With the help of http://geojson.io, we created a json file, containing the coordinates of the Iowa map as a polygon. Let us import that file
source.97b06431:
We will get the quantiles of the mean_price_per_neighborhood DF. We will obtain four prices. More specifically:
* The minimum price of the DF
* The 50th percentile
* The 75th percentile 
* And the maximum average house price

This way, we are able to classify which areas have low, mediumn and high house prices.
source.4651bf82: With a for loop we add the markers to the map. We are fully using the mean_price_per_neighborhood dataframe. We are specifying the latitude and longitude of the marker. Also, the coloring and the pop-ups depend on the average price of houses in the neighborhood.
